21. Neural Networks and Deep Learning (3)

Training of Feedforward Nets

A Graphical Illustration on Softmax

Cross-Entropy and Maximum Likelihood Estimation

  • Maximum Likelihood Estimation (MLE)
    • Examples {xn}\{\mathbf{x}_n\}{xnâ€‹}: Ptrue(x)P_{\text{true}}(\mathbf{x})Ptrueâ€‹(x) (unknown)ì—ì„œ independently drawn
    • Model: Pmodel(x;Â w)P_{\text{model}}(\mathbf{x};~\mathbf{w})Pmodelâ€‹(x;Â w) (parameters w\mathbf{w}w or Î¸\thetaÎ¸)
    • Goal: Pmodel(x;Â w)P_{\text{model}}(\mathbf{x};~\mathbf{w})Pmodelâ€‹(x;Â w)ê°€ Ptrue(x)P_{\text{true}}(\mathbf{x})Ptrueâ€‹(x) (strictly, Pempirical(x)P_{\text{empirical}}(\mathbf{x})Pempiricalâ€‹(x))ì™€ ê°€ì¥ ìœ ì‚¬í•œ w\mathbf{w}w íƒìƒ‰
    • MLE principle

    wMLE=argâ¡maxâ¡wPmodel(x;Â w)\mathbf{w}_{\text{MLE}} = \arg\max_{\mathbf{w}} P_{\text{model}}(\mathbf{x};~\mathbf{w}) wMLEâ€‹=argwmaxâ€‹Pmodelâ€‹(x;Â w)

    • Independence (Likelihood): wMLE=argâ¡maxâ¡wâˆn=1NPmodel(xn;Â w)\mathbf{w}_{\text{MLE}} = \arg\max_{\mathbf{w}} \prod_{n=1}^{N} P_{\text{model}}(\mathbf{x}_n;~\mathbf{w})wMLEâ€‹=argmaxwâ€‹âˆn=1Nâ€‹Pmodelâ€‹(xnâ€‹;Â w)
    • Log likelihood (Computational stability): wMLE=argâ¡maxâ¡wâˆ‘n=1Nlogâ¡Pmodel(xn;Â w)\mathbf{w}_{\text{MLE}} = \arg\max_{\mathbf{w}} \sum_{n=1}^{N} \log P_{\text{model}}(\mathbf{x}_n;~\mathbf{w})wMLEâ€‹=argmaxwâ€‹âˆ‘n=1Nâ€‹logPmodelâ€‹(xnâ€‹;Â w)
  • Cross-entropyì™€ MLEì˜ ê´€ê³„

wMLE=argâ¡maxâ¡wâˆ‘n=1Nlogâ¡Pmodel(xn;Â w)\mathbf{w}_{\text{MLE}} = \arg\max_{\mathbf{w}} \sum_{n=1}^{N} \log P_{\text{model}}(\mathbf{x}_n;~\mathbf{w}) wMLEâ€‹=argwmaxâ€‹n=1âˆ‘Nâ€‹logPmodelâ€‹(xnâ€‹;Â w)

  • Scaling (Argmax ë¶ˆë³€):

wMLE=argâ¡maxâ¡w1Nâˆ‘n=1Nlogâ¡Pmodel(xn;Â w)\mathbf{w}_{\text{MLE}} = \arg\max_{\mathbf{w}} \frac{1}{N} \sum_{n=1}^{N} \log P_{\text{model}}(\mathbf{x}_n;~\mathbf{w}) wMLEâ€‹=argwmaxâ€‹N1â€‹n=1âˆ‘Nâ€‹logPmodelâ€‹(xnâ€‹;Â w)

=argâ¡maxâ¡wExâˆ¼Pempirical(x)[logâ¡Pmodel(x;Â w)]= \arg\max_{\mathbf{w}} \mathbb{E}_{\mathbf{x} \sim P_{\text{empirical}}(\mathbf{x})}[\log P_{\text{model}}(\mathbf{x};~\mathbf{w})] =argwmaxâ€‹Exâˆ¼Pempiricalâ€‹(x)â€‹[logPmodelâ€‹(x;Â w)]

  • P(x)=Pempirical(x)P(\mathbf{x}) = P_{\text{empirical}}(\mathbf{x})P(x)=Pempiricalâ€‹(x), Q(x)=Pmodel(x;Â w)Q(\mathbf{x}) = P_{\text{model}}(\mathbf{x};~\mathbf{w})Q(x)=Pmodelâ€‹(x;Â w)ë¡œ ì¹˜í™˜

wMLE=argâ¡maxâ¡wEP(x)[logâ¡Q(x)]\mathbf{w}_{\text{MLE}} = \arg\max_{\mathbf{w}} \mathbb{E}_{P(\mathbf{x})}[\log Q(\mathbf{x})] wMLEâ€‹=argwmaxâ€‹EP(x)â€‹[logQ(x)]

=argâ¡minâ¡wâˆ’EP(x)[logâ¡Q(x)]=argâ¡minâ¡wH(P,Q)= \arg\min_{\mathbf{w}} - \mathbb{E}_{P(\mathbf{x})}[\log Q(\mathbf{x})] = \arg\min_{\mathbf{w}} H(P, Q) =argwminâ€‹âˆ’EP(x)â€‹[logQ(x)]=argwminâ€‹H(P,Q)

  • ê²°ë¡ 
    • MLEë¥¼ ì‚¬ìš©í•œ wMLE\mathbf{w}_{\text{MLE}}wMLEâ€‹ íšë“ ë¬¸ì œëŠ” Pempirical(x)P_{\text{empirical}}(\mathbf{x})Pempiricalâ€‹(x)ì™€ Pmodel(x;Â w)P_{\text{model}}(\mathbf{x};~\mathbf{w})Pmodelâ€‹(x;Â w) ê°„ì˜ cross-entropy ìµœì†Œí™” ë¬¸ì œì™€ ë™ì¼

Parameter Optimization

  • Task: ì„ íƒëœ E(w)E(\mathbf{w})E(w)ë¥¼ ìµœì†Œí™”í•˜ëŠ” weight vector w\mathbf{w}w íƒìƒ‰
  • Global minimum: ëª¨ë“  weight vectorì— ëŒ€í•´ error functionì˜ ê°€ì¥ ì‘ì€ ê°’ì— í•´ë‹¹í•˜ëŠ” minimum
  • Local minima: Error functionì˜ ë” ë†’ì€ ê°’ì— í•´ë‹¹í•˜ëŠ” ë‹¤ë¥¸ ëª¨ë“  minima
  • Note: Neural networkì˜ ì„±ê³µì  ì ìš©ì„ ìœ„í•´ global minimum íƒìƒ‰ì´ í•„ìˆ˜ì ì´ ì•„ë‹ ìˆ˜ ìˆìŒ, ì¶©ë¶„íˆ ì¢‹ì€ solutionì„ ìœ„í•´ ì—¬ëŸ¬ local minima ë¹„êµ í•„ìš”

Forward Propagation & Backpropagation

  • Error backpropagation (or simply backprop)
    • Feed-forward neural networkì˜ error function E(w)E(\mathbf{w})E(w)ì˜ gradient âˆ‡E(w)\nabla E(\mathbf{w})âˆ‡E(w)ë¥¼ í‰ê°€í•˜ëŠ” íš¨ìœ¨ì ì¸ ê¸°ìˆ 
    • Chain ruleì„ ë§¤ìš° íš¨ìœ¨ì ì¸ íŠ¹ì • ì—°ì‚° ìˆœì„œë¡œ ê³„ì‚°í•˜ëŠ” algorithm
  • Our example
    • A simple layered network (sigmoidal hidden units, sum-of-squares error)
  • In a general feed-forward network,
    • ê° unitì€ weighted sum ê³„ì‚°

    aj=âˆ‘iwjizia_j = \sum_i w_{ji} z_i ajâ€‹=iâˆ‘â€‹wjiâ€‹ziâ€‹

    • ziz_iziâ€‹: Unit jjjë¡œ connectionì„ ë³´ë‚´ëŠ” unit/inputì˜ activation
    • wjiw_{ji}wjiâ€‹: Connectionê³¼ ì—°ê´€ëœ weight
    • aja_jajâ€‹ëŠ” nonlinear activation function h(â‹…)h(\cdot)h(â‹…)ì— ì˜í•´ ë³€í™˜ë˜ì–´ unit jjjì˜ activation zjz_jzjâ€‹ ìƒì„±

    zj=h(aj)z_j = h(a_j) zjâ€‹=h(ajâ€‹)

Forward Propagation

  • For each pattern in the training set
    • Input vectorë¥¼ networkì— ì œê³µ
    • aja_jajâ€‹ì™€ zjz_jzjâ€‹ì˜ ì—°ì† ì ìš©ìœ¼ë¡œ ëª¨ë“  hidden unit ë° output unitì˜ activation ê³„ì‚°
    • ì´ processëŠ” forward propagationì´ë¼ ë¶ˆë¦¼ (ì •ë³´ì˜ forward flow)

Chain Rule of Calculus

  • Chain rule for scalars
    • y=g(x)y = g(x)y=g(x) ì´ê³  z=f(g(x))=f(y)z = f(g(x)) = f(y)z=f(g(x))=f(y) ì¼ ë•Œ

      dzdx=dzdyâ‹…dydx\frac{dz}{dx} = \frac{dz}{dy} \cdot \frac{dy}{dx} dxdzâ€‹=dydzâ€‹â‹…dxdyâ€‹

  • Chain rule for vectors
    • xâˆˆRm,Â yâˆˆRn\mathbf{x} \in \mathbb{R}^m,~\mathbf{y} \in \mathbb{R}^nxâˆˆRm,Â yâˆˆRn, y=g(x)\mathbf{y} = g(\mathbf{x})y=g(x) ì´ê³  z=f(y)z = f(\mathbf{y})z=f(y) ì¼ ë•Œ

      âˆ‚zâˆ‚xi=âˆ‘jâˆ‚zâˆ‚yjâ‹…âˆ‚yjâˆ‚xi\frac{\partial z}{\partial x_i} = \sum_j \frac{\partial z}{\partial y_j} \cdot \frac{\partial y_j}{\partial x_i} âˆ‚xiâ€‹âˆ‚zâ€‹=jâˆ‘â€‹âˆ‚yjâ€‹âˆ‚zâ€‹â‹…âˆ‚xiâ€‹âˆ‚yjâ€‹â€‹

    • Vector notation

      âˆ‡xz=(âˆ‚yâˆ‚x)Tâˆ‡yz\nabla_{\mathbf{x}} z = (\frac{\partial \mathbf{y}}{\partial \mathbf{x}})^T \nabla_{\mathbf{y}} z âˆ‡xâ€‹z=(âˆ‚xâˆ‚yâ€‹)Tâˆ‡yâ€‹z

    • âˆ‚yâˆ‚x\frac{\partial \mathbf{y}}{\partial \mathbf{x}}âˆ‚xâˆ‚yâ€‹ëŠ” gggì˜ nÃ—mn \times mnÃ—m Jacobian matrix

Backpropagation

  • EnE_nEnâ€‹ì˜ wjiw_{ji}wjiâ€‹ì— ëŒ€í•œ derivative í‰ê°€
    • EnE_nEnâ€‹ì€ wjiw_{ji}wjiâ€‹ì— ëŒ€í•´ ì˜¤ì§ summed input aja_jajâ€‹ë¥¼ í†µí•´ì„œë§Œ Dependant
    • Chain rule: âˆ‚Enâˆ‚wji=âˆ‚Enâˆ‚ajâ‹…âˆ‚ajâˆ‚wji\frac{\partial E_n}{\partial w_{ji}} = \frac{\partial E_n}{\partial a_j} \cdot \frac{\partial a_j}{\partial w_{ji}}âˆ‚wjiâ€‹âˆ‚Enâ€‹â€‹=âˆ‚ajâ€‹âˆ‚Enâ€‹â€‹â‹…âˆ‚wjiâ€‹âˆ‚ajâ€‹â€‹
    • Notation (errors Î´\deltaÎ´): Î´jâ‰¡âˆ‚Enâˆ‚aj\delta_j \equiv \frac{\partial E_n}{\partial a_j}Î´jâ€‹â‰¡âˆ‚ajâ€‹âˆ‚Enâ€‹â€‹
    • âˆ‚ajâˆ‚wji=zi\frac{\partial a_j}{\partial w_{ji}} = z_iâˆ‚wjiâ€‹âˆ‚ajâ€‹â€‹=ziâ€‹
    • Result: âˆ‚Enâˆ‚wji=Î´jâ‹…zi\frac{\partial E_n}{\partial w_{ji}} = \delta_j \cdot z_iâˆ‚wjiâ€‹âˆ‚Enâ€‹â€‹=Î´jâ€‹â‹…ziâ€‹
  • âˆ‚Enâˆ‚wji=Î´jâ‹…zi\frac{\partial E_n}{\partial w_{ji}} = \delta_j \cdot z_iâˆ‚wjiâ€‹âˆ‚Enâ€‹â€‹=Î´jâ€‹â‹…ziâ€‹
    • Required derivative: Weightì˜ output end unit(jjj)ì˜ Î´\deltaÎ´ ê°’ê³¼ input end unit(iii)ì˜ ziz_iziâ€‹ ê°’ì„ ê³±í•˜ì—¬ íšë“
  • Derivative í‰ê°€: Networkì˜ ê° hidden/output unitì— ëŒ€í•œ Î´j\delta_jÎ´jâ€‹ ê°’ ê³„ì‚° í•„ìš”
  • For the output units (with L2 loss, assuming identity activation yj=ajy_j = a_jyjâ€‹=ajâ€‹)
    • En(w)=12âˆ‘k(ykâˆ’tk)2E_n(\mathbf{w}) = \frac{1}{2} \sum_k (y_k - t_k)^2Enâ€‹(w)=21â€‹âˆ‘kâ€‹(ykâ€‹âˆ’tkâ€‹)2
    • Î´j=yjâˆ’tj\delta_j = y_j - t_jÎ´jâ€‹=yjâ€‹âˆ’tjâ€‹
  • To evaluate the Î´\deltaÎ´'s for hidden units,
    • Chain rule: Î´jâ‰¡âˆ‚Enâˆ‚aj=âˆ‘kâˆ‚Enâˆ‚akâ‹…âˆ‚akâˆ‚aj\delta_j \equiv \frac{\partial E_n}{\partial a_j} = \sum_k \frac{\partial E_n}{\partial a_k} \cdot \frac{\partial a_k}{\partial a_j}Î´jâ€‹â‰¡âˆ‚ajâ€‹âˆ‚Enâ€‹â€‹=âˆ‘kâ€‹âˆ‚akâ€‹âˆ‚Enâ€‹â€‹â‹…âˆ‚ajâ€‹âˆ‚akâ€‹â€‹ (sum over units kkk to which unit jjj sends connections)
    • âˆ‚akâˆ‚aj=âˆ‚akâˆ‚zjâ‹…âˆ‚zjâˆ‚aj=wkjâ‹…hâ€²(aj)\frac{\partial a_k}{\partial a_j} = \frac{\partial a_k}{\partial z_j} \cdot \frac{\partial z_j}{\partial a_j} = w_{kj} \cdot h'(a_j)âˆ‚ajâ€‹âˆ‚akâ€‹â€‹=âˆ‚zjâ€‹âˆ‚akâ€‹â€‹â‹…âˆ‚ajâ€‹âˆ‚zjâ€‹â€‹=wkjâ€‹â‹…hâ€²(ajâ€‹)
  • Backpropagation formula
    • Î´j=hâ€²(aj)âˆ‘kwkjÎ´k\delta_j = h'(a_j) \sum_k w_{kj} \delta_kÎ´jâ€‹=hâ€²(ajâ€‹)âˆ‘kâ€‹wkjâ€‹Î´kâ€‹
    • Hidden unitì˜ Î´\deltaÎ´: Network ìƒìœ„ unitìœ¼ë¡œë¶€í„° Î´\deltaÎ´ë¥¼ backwardë¡œ propagateí•˜ì—¬ íšë“

Automatic Differentiation

  • Gradient computation: Forward propagationì˜ symbolic expressionì—ì„œ ìë™ ì¶”ë¡  ê°€ëŠ¥
  • Modern DL frameworks (Tensorflow, PyTorch, etc.): Backpropagation ìë™ ìˆ˜í–‰

A Simple Example of Backprop

  • Function: f(x,Â y,Â z)=(x+y)zf(x,~y,~z) = (x+y)zf(x,Â y,Â z)=(x+y)z
  • Intermediate variable: q=x+yq = x+yq=x+y, f=qzf = qzf=qz
  • Example values: x=âˆ’2,Â y=5,Â z=âˆ’4x = -2,~y = 5,~z = -4x=âˆ’2,Â y=5,Â z=âˆ’4
  • Forward propagation
    • q=x+yâ†’q=âˆ’2+5=3q = x + y \quad \rightarrow \quad q = -2 + 5 = 3q=x+yâ†’q=âˆ’2+5=3
    • f=qzâ†’f=3Ã—(âˆ’4)=âˆ’12f = qz \quad \rightarrow \quad f = 3 \times (-4) = -12f=qzâ†’f=3Ã—(âˆ’4)=âˆ’12
  • Backpropagation (computing gradients)

    • âˆ‚fâˆ‚f=1\frac{\partial f}{\partial f} = 1âˆ‚fâˆ‚fâ€‹=1

    • âˆ‚fâˆ‚z=q=3\frac{\partial f}{\partial z} = q = 3âˆ‚zâˆ‚fâ€‹=q=3 (Local gradient âˆ‚fâˆ‚z=q\frac{\partial f}{\partial z} = qâˆ‚zâˆ‚fâ€‹=q)

    • âˆ‚fâˆ‚q=z=âˆ’4\frac{\partial f}{\partial q} = z = -4âˆ‚qâˆ‚fâ€‹=z=âˆ’4 (Local gradient âˆ‚fâˆ‚q=z\frac{\partial f}{\partial q} = zâˆ‚qâˆ‚fâ€‹=z)

    • âˆ‚fâˆ‚y=âˆ‚fâˆ‚qâ‹…âˆ‚qâˆ‚y=(âˆ’4)â‹…(1)=âˆ’4\frac{\partial f}{\partial y} = \frac{\partial f}{\partial q} \cdot \frac{\partial q}{\partial y} = (-4) \cdot (1) = -4âˆ‚yâˆ‚fâ€‹=âˆ‚qâˆ‚fâ€‹â‹…âˆ‚yâˆ‚qâ€‹=(âˆ’4)â‹…(1)=âˆ’4 (Upstream âˆ‚fâˆ‚q\frac{\partial f}{\partial q}âˆ‚qâˆ‚fâ€‹, Local âˆ‚qâˆ‚y=1\frac{\partial q}{\partial y} = 1âˆ‚yâˆ‚qâ€‹=1)

    • âˆ‚fâˆ‚x=âˆ‚fâˆ‚qâ‹…âˆ‚qâˆ‚x=(âˆ’4)â‹…(1)=âˆ’4\frac{\partial f}{\partial x} = \frac{\partial f}{\partial q} \cdot \frac{\partial q}{\partial x} = (-4) \cdot (1) = -4âˆ‚xâˆ‚fâ€‹=âˆ‚qâˆ‚fâ€‹â‹…âˆ‚xâˆ‚qâ€‹=(âˆ’4)â‹…(1)=âˆ’4 (Upstream âˆ‚fâˆ‚q\frac{\partial f}{\partial q}âˆ‚qâˆ‚fâ€‹, Local âˆ‚qâˆ‚x=1\frac{\partial q}{\partial x} = 1âˆ‚xâˆ‚qâ€‹=1)

  • Pattern: Gate (ì—°ì‚°)ëŠ” local gradientë¥¼ ê³„ì‚°í•˜ê³ , ì´ë¥¼ upstream gradientì™€ ê³±í•˜ì—¬ downstream gradient ê³„ì‚°
